isis.stitle: CE 200 AND CE 300 BUS BODY COMPONENTS - Exterior Body Repair - Remove

svcsubproc.title: Fasteners
svcsubproc.para: The fasteners utilized in the manufacture and assembly of the bus body are mechanical type fasteners. Each joint is designed in a manner that it is imperative to replace all body panels and fasteners with OEM equipment. All body panels are required to meet federal standard F.M.V.S.S. 221. This standard establishes that all body panels must meet 60% joint strength requirements. Because of this standard and International design, it is very difficult to remove certain body panels. The following procedure will describe what is required to replace damaged body panels, in most conditions. Only trained technicians should perform the repair work.

step1.para: Remove all rivets from the damaged panels.
Center punch all rivets in preparation for removal. This is important in order to prevent damage to panels that over- or underlap damaged panels.
Utilizing a heavy duty reversible drill and 17/64" diameter drill bit, drill through the rivet head until rivet sleeve separates from the rivet head.
Remove all rivets from the damaged body panel. The rivets may be removed by using a large chisel and a #10 drill bit.
With the head or cap of rivet removed, use drill to remove sleeve of the rivet out of the body panel.
With rivets and sleeves removed from body panel, check panel overlap. New body panels must be installed with same panel overlap as that of removed panel.
Removal of some panels may require removal of body rub rails, depending on the location of the damage.
If rub rails are to be removed, follow procedure for removing rivets.

svcsubproc.title: End Cap Remove
svcsubproc.para: When removing the front end cap, the exterior rear view mirrors and any electrical connections for mirrors must be removed.

step1.para: See mirror removal section of this manual for removal of exterior rear view mirrors.
The windshield and side panels must also be removed prior to removing end cap rivets. (Refer to windshield removal.)
Following rivet removal procedure, remove as many rivets from end cap drip rail as needed to free front end cap for removal.
